servings cooked japanese short-grain rice (approx. 250 g per serving) pickled red ginger (beni shoga or kizami beni shoga) thinly slice the onion (113g). diagonally slice the green onion (1 piece). cut the semi-frozen beef (227g) into 7.6 cm wide pieces. in a large frying pan, combine 120 ml dashi, 30 ml sake, 30 ml mirin, 45 ml soy sauce, and 15 g sugar. spread onion slices evenly in the pan. place beef slices over the onions, separating them. cover and simmer on medium heat for 3-4 minutes. skim off any scum or fat from the broth. sprinkle with green onions and cook for 1 more minute. place cooked japanese short-grain rice (approx. 250 g per serving) in bowls and drizzle with sauce. add beef and onions over rice, then garnish with pickled red ginger. gyudon (japanische
